extendedInfo.description: Want to learn Korean? Namu is a fun and easy way to help you expand your Korean vocabulary at your own pace. With over 1,000 words split into bitesize topics and levels, you can quiz yourself to help memorise Korean words, earn achievements and unlock content.This LITE version offers a free experience of Namu with 18 topic books, three books for each level. To get the FULL version, search "Namu" on the Market.FULL version key features+ Over 1,000 Korean words across 48 topics+ Hangul, romanization, english & audio for every word+ Quiz yourself to unlock levels as you learn words+ Tracks your performance to determine which words you've memorised+ 20 special achievements to discover

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Awesome app! I learned korean/hangul so easy and its so fun to use. I wish full version can be available free.
reviews.author: Wendy Lindog

reviews.title: FullScreen
reviews.comment: I used to love this app when I had my old phone so.as soon as I got my S4 I downloaded it, but the app its not in full screen, its like a small rectangle in the middle of my screen, I\'m uninstalling until fixed.
reviews.author: leslie blok

reviews.title: Amazing application
reviews.comment: I also instaled full version on my galaxy fit and my galaxy mini.... I like the app somuch. I learning korean on my way :D
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I love it
reviews.comment: It is very useful with no ads at all.I learnt up to 50 words a day, and I specially like the way I can learn in my own pace. however, it will be even better if there was a section where we can add our own vocab.the graphics are also very good, and it is so far the best app I have downloaded.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: 2 things
reviews.comment: Simple, straight-forward, user friendly app. See the word in English and Korean. Hear the word, and easy navigation. HOWEVER, its just not complete without, 1)  WRITEN PRONUNCIATIONs; this will really help when you have trouble understanding the audibles. And 2) AUDIO RECOGNITION; so you can check if you are saying the word correctly.
reviews.author: Maria Celis

reviews.title: I love it
reviews.comment: It\'s cute and customizable to my studying habits and easy to use. It helps set goals so I work harder. Amazing app and I\'d love to get the full thing
reviews.author: Sharay Dennis

reviews.title: Helpful :-)
reviews.comment: This was VERY helpful. I leatned alot and I\'m starting to understand more korean each day. I REALLY like this app.     But i wish they can make have the full version for free :-( :\'(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: Fun, useful application. Best I\'ve tried for learning Korean.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It is a great way to learn Korean
Excellent and very cute
reviews.comment: A fun way to memorise vocab.. I really like the design too
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: This is a great help just wish the full version was down to a dollar, I\'d buy it then. Add a feature so we can add our own vocab?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: I wish the full ver. Was free /:

reviews.comment: I really love korean language and this app help me to learn it thanks
reviews.author: Maitha Aljunaibi

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment: Really helpful app for learning Korean words, fun and easy to use.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fix audio
reviews.comment: I like this app its very useful but the audio won\'t play. Please fix!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Program
reviews.comment: One of the best Korean language programs to be found anywhere.  Highly recommend buying full version for more words.  Note- Programmers of this program should use install to SD card option.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty good!
reviews.comment: This is very useful however i experienced a few glitches. I wish i could reset my memorised words so i could practice them again. :/
reviews.author: Ahsaki Hawkins
